thread.title: Luggage piles up after power cut at Heathrow
thread.title_full: Luggage piles up after power cut at Heathrow

title: Luggage piles up after power cut at Heathrow
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Luggage piles up after power cut at Heathrow Angry passengers posted pictures on social media of luggage piled high in the departure lounge Angry passengers posted pictures on social media of luggage piled high in the departure lounge Graeme Paton Transport Correspondent Published 1 minute ago 
Holidaymakers faced chaos at Heathrow yesterday when thousands of passengers were forced to board flights without their luggage. 
A power cut at Terminal 5 resulted in about 50 British Airways flights taking off with cases and other equipment left behind. The failure, which happened at about 7am, created lengthy queues at check-in desks as conveyor belts ground to a halt. 
Angry passengers posted pictures on social media of luggage piled high in the departure lounge. Many were told to fly without luggage or face missing their flight altogether, while people flying in to the airport were forced to wait up Subscribe now
